RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 66. Allowance Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 30 Allowed 3 lbs. (Claiming Races For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility). (If necessary will be run SAME DISTANCE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MALIBU ROCK STAR was hustled along pursuing through the turn losing ground to upper stretch surging eight wide getting up at the wire. OMEGA GOLD hustled along chased while losing ground to upper stretch dueling inside of rival late in the seven path just missing. SHOSHA chased the pace through the turn into upper stretch vying willingly late inside of wide closers. ROCKIN MACHEN sent hard pressed the pace dueling through the turn into upper stretch ceding late along the inside. HARTEL rushed hard pressed three deep leaving the turn battling in upper stretch coming up a touch short in the three path. CHEEKY CHAPS slow early would edge a bit closer late. FULL OF LIFE pressed the pace through the turn then weakened in the four path upper stretch. WILD WINE bumped at the break dueled between horses on the turn into upper stretch fading late on the rail. REGAL HOLIDAY played no factor bearing out in mid stretch. OUR GOLDEN BOY took a bad after the break pulling up and vanning off after the race.

ENTRY.NAME: Regal Holiday
ENTRY.OWNER: Gray Christopher L and Gray Melissa R
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor, bore out lane

ENTRY.NAME: Full of Life
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Wild Wine
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break, pressed pace between, faded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Our Golden Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bad step, pulled up, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Cheeky Chaps
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, closed some late

ENTRY.NAME: Omega Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, chased wide to lane, dueled late seven path

ENTRY.NAME: Shosha
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, rallied upper stretch vied willingly late

ENTRY.NAME: Rockin Machen
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard, pressed pace, dueled inside lane, out finished

ENTRY.NAME: Hartel
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed hard, pressed three deep to lane, bit short

ENTRY.NAME: Malibu Rock Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, lost ground to lane, surged 8 wide, up at wire

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Allan Chappell, Lori Chappell & Spendthrift Farms, LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 7F Turf CR: 85. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 30 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOT SO EASY saved grlound early angling out in upper stretch firing past mid track getting up in the last strides. ERIC THE SALESMAN sent clear set the pace through the far turn digging in to upper stretch angling out to meet wide pressure battling to the wire. FULL OF LUCK (CHI) gave a prompted middle move chasing through the far turn extending down the lane being right there at the wire between horses. DYNAFORM stalked the pace chasing to upper stretch coming up a touch short late in the three path. CORAL LEGACY raced evenly throughout being roused down the lane finding no finishing move. AREYOUTALKINGTOME raced wide early proving no menace. ZERO FOR CONDUCT played no factor. COLONEL MIKE hustled wide would tire. FEVOLA was always outrun. PRETTY STORMY showed early speed then faded on the rail to upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Eric the Salesman
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, set pace, dug in to lane, angled out, battled late

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Stormy
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, rail fade

ENTRY.NAME: Not So Easy
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, angled out lane, rallied up past mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Coral Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, roused to lane, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Full of Luck (CHI)
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, chased to lane, right there late between horses

ENTRY.NAME: Fevola
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Zero for Conduct
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Areyoutalkingtome
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide trip, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Dynaform
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased to lane, touch short three path

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Mike
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled wide, tired,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 7F Turf CR: 84. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 30 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELLE BREZING saved ground rallying inside on the far turn swinging out in upper stretch ending up in the seven path rallying up from there. SELLING OUT slow early lagged to upper stretch responding late splitting horses saving place. BRIAR JUMPER slow early raced inside in upper stretch vying willingly late. KREWE CHIEF slow early lost ground to upper stretch gaining a bit late six wide. CLOONTIA stalked the pace pressing to draw even abreast rival in upper stretch fading late in the four parh. PONT DU GARD hustled on the outside weakened eight wide down the lane. HARD ASTRAY sent clear set the pace through the far turn being hooked in upper stretch giving way under pressure. KITTEN BY THE SEA played no factor. HOLY TRUTH was never involved. REUX (GB) stalked to the far turn then wilted into upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Cloontia
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, pressed into lane, drew even, faded late 4p

ENTRY.NAME: Belle Brezing
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, fired inside far turn, swung out lane, rallied up

ENTRY.NAME: Reux (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Quaintance Janet Celtic Venture Stable and Hickory Made Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, wilted into lane

ENTRY.NAME: Kitten by the Sea
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Briar Jumper
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, inside to lane, vied willingly late

ENTRY.NAME: Hard Astray
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, set pace, hooked top lane, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Selling Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lagged to lane, split horses with late surge

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Krewe Chief
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lost ground to lane, gained a bit 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Pont Du Gard
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled outside, 8 wide lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 5F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 7700. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHISH KABOB pressed the pace racing three deep into the turn wresting a clear lead at the quarter pole widening in upper stretch holding firm to wire. NYSSA pressed the pace being briefly in close along the rail near the three eighths pole angling out in upper stretch finishing a clear second best. GOT MORE pressed between horses early chasing on the turn to upper stretch weakening late. ADRIANA ES BONITA was in tight at the rail steadying near then seven sixteenths pole. ARISTA THE CAT veered out losing the rider at the break. AN OBJECTION FROM THE RIDER OF NYSSA AGAINST THE RIDER OF SHISH KABOB FOR INTERFERENCE ON THE TURN WAS DISMISSED BY THE STEWARDS.

ENTRY.NAME: Adriana Es Bonita
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight steadied rail 7/16

ENTRY.NAME: Nyssa
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, in close rail turn, angled out lane, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Got More
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, chased on turn, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Arista the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered break, lost jockey, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Shish Kabob
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, three deep to turn, shook clear to lane, held firm

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 30, 2022. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIGH HEAVEN pressed the pace along the inside wresting the lead on the turn edging clear in upper stretch drifting out late holding safe to wire. UNDETECTED slow early swung out to upper stretch rallying late six wide saving place. CYBERBURG slow early was hustled seven wide through the turn then down the stretch rallying late. SUGAR BRITCHES pressed early then chased on the turn weakening in upper stretch. ORBETTE pressed the pace chasing to upper stretch coming up short at mid track. CASSIE'S RAINBOW pressed the pace through the turn then tired down the lane. FASHION FRAME was always outrun. BAD KARMA pressed the pace through the turn then wore out in upper stretch.

ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: High Heaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, led inside turn, cleared lane, drifted late

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Britches
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early, chased turn, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Cassie's Rainbow
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, tired lane

ENTRY.NAME: Bad Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, spent lane

ENTRY.NAME: Undetected
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, swung out to lane, rallied 6 wide, saved place

ENTRY.NAME: Orbette
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, chased lane, short mid tk

ENTRY.NAME: Cyberburg
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, hustled 7 wide turn and down the lane, rallied late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 5F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 30, 2022. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAJESTIC SEAS pressed the pace wresting a clear lead on the turn being hooked in upper stretch fighting back on the inside of rival prevailing gamely. MUNTIJ chased the pace rallying to draw even abreast rival in upper stretch dueling from the eighth pole being out gamed at the end. KOLSCH chased the pace through the turn extending into upper stretch finishing evenly. I'M A COOL MAN hustled along weakened in upper stretch. WILD RIVER WOLF pressed the pace through the turn wearing down the final eighth. SUDDENLY SEDUCTIVE played no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Kolsch
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased the pace, extended lane, finished evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Wild River Wolf
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, wore down lane

ENTRY.NAME: Muntij

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 30 Allowed 3 lbs. (Claimin g Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WAR NOVEL sent clear moved alert on lead widening to upper stretch holding firm the final eighth. PALACE PRINCE gave a prompted middle move chasing through the far turn being rebuffed in upper stretch holding well as second best. BLUEBANK slow early gained position on the far turn racing evenly down the lane as best of others. BORN FOR VICTORY stalked the early pace then faded abruptly on the far turn. SECRET SANCTUARY tracked the early pace then gave way on the far turn. JOYFUL CANDY clipped heels losing the rider walking off after the race.

ENTRY.NAME: Joyful Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: clipped heels, lost jockey, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Born for Victory
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Sanctuary
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked early, gave way far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Palace Prince
ENTRY.OWNER: Tijuana Racing Stables Tenenbaum Jeffrey and Bloom Jeffrey
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, chased far turn, rebuffed lane, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Bluebank
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, moved up far turn, evenly lane, best others

ENTRY.NAME: War Novel
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, set pace, widened to lane, held firm

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: McMahon of Saratoga Thoroughbreds, LLC,Hunter Valley Farm

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 30, 2022. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LE GENERAL sent clear set the pace drawing off to upper stretch pouring it on late. CHATTERMAN went evenly through the turn lagging to upper stretch rallying late to save place. MACHINIST away alertly chased through the turn proving no match down the lane hanging late. AMERICAN FLEET slow early lost ground to upper stretch moving up late seven wide. RY'S REVENGE played no factor. PROFESSIONAL chased early then faded on the turn. PEAR LEMONADE was always outrun. CRAFTY DADDY hustled along pursued through the turn then gave way in upper stretch. BIG SAVER gave way on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Le General
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, widened on lead, won going away

ENTRY.NAME: Professional
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased early, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Big Saver
ENTRY.COMMENT: gave way on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Pear Lemonade
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Ry's Revenge
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: American Fleet
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lost ground to lane, moved up late 7 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Chatterman
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, lagged to lane, came on late for place

ENTRY.NAME: Machinist
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, chased through the turn, no match, hung late

ENTRY.NAME: Crafty Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, pursued through the turn, gave way lane
